summary: Thomas W. Sacco was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents provide his name, and in some cases, his salary and employment dates within the HSCA. The documents span from April 1978 to December 1978, indicating his period of employment with the committee.
significance: Thomas W. Sacco's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member involved in the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
